channel.title: A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content on A Hugo website
channel.item:
Edit image using python /2020/08/14/edit-image-using-python/ Fri, 14 Aug 2020 00:00:00 +0000 <<<<<<< HEAD =======
/2020/08/14/edit-image-using-python/ from PIL import Image, ImageFilter image = Image.open('../../1.png') image2 = image.filter(ImageFilter.CONTOUR) image2.save('../../2.png') image.show() image1 image2.show() image2

item.title: How to derive the beautiful probability density function (pdf) of Normal Distribution?
item.description: How can we derive the probability density function (pdf) of Normal Distribution? \[f_Y(y)=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2\pi}\sigma}e^{-\frac{1}{2}(\frac{y-\mu}{\sigma})^2}, \quad -\infty<y<+\infty\] Let’s draw a normal pdf first #draw normal pdf x <- seq(-5, 5, length.out = 201); dx <- diff(x)[1] y <- dnorm(x, mean = 0, sd = 1) base::plot(x, y, type = "l", col = "skyblue", xlab="x" , ylab="p(x)" , cex.lab=1.5, main="Normal Probability Density" , cex.main=1.5, lwd=2) text( 0, .6*max(y) , bquote( paste(mu ," = 0 ") ) , cex=1.

item.title: Using Tikz
item.description: TikZ picture TikZ picture Here is a TikZ picutre \begin{tikzpicture} \draw (0,0) circle (2cm); \end{tikzpicture} Here is another TikZ picutre \begin{tikzpicture} \begin{axis}[xmax=9,ymax=9, samples=50] \addplot[blue, ultra thick] (x,xx); \addplot[red, ultra thick] (xx,x); \end{axis} \end{tikzpicture}

<<<<<<< HEAD How to derive the beautiful probability density function (pdf) of Normal Distribution? /2020/08/13/distributions/ Thu, 13 Aug 2020 00:00:00 +0000
/2020/08/13/distributions/ How can we derive the probability density function (pdf) of Normal Distribution? \[f_Y(y)=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2\pi}\sigma}e^{-\frac{1}{2}(\frac{y-\mu}{\sigma})^2}, \quad -\infty<y<+\infty\] Let’s draw a normal pdf first #draw normal pdf x <- seq(-5, 5, length.out = 201); dx <- diff(x)[1] y <- dnorm(x, mean = 0, sd = 1) base::plot(x, y, type = "l", col = "skyblue", xlab="x" , ylab="p(x)" , cex.lab=1.5, main="Normal Probability Density" , cex.main=1.5, lwd=2) text( 0, .6*max(y) , bquote( paste(mu ," = 0 ") ) , cex=1.

item.title: Running wsl commands using system2() function in R
item.description: Accession number NC_045512 in Fasta format. Using “wsl” command in system2() to run commands in wsl system2("wsl", "cd ~/bioinfor/; ls", stdout = TRUE) ## [1] "AF086833.gb" "NC_045512-version1.fa" "RNASeqByExample" ## [4] "chr22.fa" "runinfo.csv" We can retrieve the SARS-coronavirus 2 gene sequences using efetch system2("wsl","efetch -db=nuccore -format=gb -id=NC_045512", stdout = "../../../NC_045512.gb") Accession number NC_045512 in Fasta format. system2("wsl","efetch -db=nuccore -format=fasta -id=NC_045512 > NC_045512.fa", stdout = TRUE) ## character(0) system2("wsl", "cat .

channel.item:
======= >>>>>>> 072ae123a94428496332cb63a55dcdba4d380e36 About /about/ Thu, 05 May 2016 21:48:51 -0700
/about/ This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
